title: Why are humans selfish and violent? - Quora

response.answer_text: I want to quote from 'The virtue of Selfishness' written by my favorite author Ayn Rand to begin my answer :“To love is to value. Only a rationally selfish man, a man of self esteem, is capable of love - because he is the only man capable of holding firm, consistent, uncompromising, unbetrayed value. The man who does not value himself, cannot value anything or anyone” I believe this explains selfishness in a fair, undistorted way. The concept of Evolution is 'Survival of the Fittest'. Thus, only those who fits in the environment are capable of surviving and the offspring will be generated with additional features to survive . So, it says it’s preferable to put yourself first in order to survive in the process of evolution.  But, in the perception of our society selfish people are mean and they are good for nothing. But, the basic point here is that everybody’s selfish by default .Take children, they know nothing about social conventions. They’ll be selfish not by choice but by default. They are concerned only about themselves, they won’t even let their siblings to touch their things. As they grow up, they’ll start realizing that the appreciation will be given only to those who think about others and those who are selfish are treated as mean. As they are living in a society with complex interactions, in order to get appreciation and to fit in, they’ll start hiding their selfishness and start acting like they care in order to survive. But it still EXISTS deep inside waiting for the time. According to new research, it’s found that Evolution does not favour selfish people. Scientists say that for a short time and against a specific set of opponents, some selfish organisms may come out ahead. But selfishness isn’t evolutionarily sustainable. May be that's why we are covering our selfishness with so called ‘positive’ traits. Thus, we can expect an unselfish offspring soon :D It might not be a common trait in humans anymore. Thank you
